metadata.title: CVE-2024-0775 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the __ext4_remount in fs/ext4/super.c inext4 in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local user to cause aninformation leak problem while freeing the old quota file names before apotential failure, leading to a use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic-64k - 5.15.0-83.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1041-kvm - 5.15.0-1041.46
No subscription required

No subscription required
